floodArea.county: Birmingham, Dudley, Sandwell, Solihull, Walsall, Warwickshire, Wolverhampton

items.message: This flood alert remains active and has been updated as thunderstorms and heavy rain have been forecast again for this area this afternoon and into the evening (Monday 12th June 2023). There is uncertainty however, over the amount of rainfall expected and the exact location of these thunderstorms. River and surface water flooding may affect these areas. We urge you to remain vigilant and avoid walking and driving through flood water. We are continuing to actively monitor the situation closely and will issue updates, and further flood alerts and warnings if necessary. You can monitor your local weather conditions and river levels on the GOV.UK website.

This message has been issued pre-emptively ahead of localised thunderstorms expected between 15:00 and 21:00 today, Monday 12/06/23. Given the unpredictable nature of thunderstorms, there is low confidence in the locations and impacts of rainfall at this point. Areas most at risk are low lying agricultural land, roads and footpaths close to small rivers and streams. Water levels could rise rapidly and potentially generate deep, fast flows. Thunderstorms are forecast this afternoon into this evening, with low confidence over exact timing and locations. We are closely monitoring the situation. Please plan driving routes to avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and see the GOV.UK website for a 5 day flood forecast. This message will be updated tomorrow morning, 13/06/23, or as the situation changes

This Flood Alert has been removed. 
The risk of flooding from Sunday's thunderstorms has now passed. Further heavy rain showers are possible this afternoon (Monday 12/06/2023) but we do not expect them to significantly raise river levels. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

This Flood Alert has been removed. 
The risk of flooding from Sunday's thunderstorms has now passed. Further heavy rain showers are possible this afternoon (Monday 12/06/2023) but we do not expect them to significantly raise river levels. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.

This Flood Warning has been removed.  
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold.  We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this warning if necessary.  Thunderstorms are forecast over the next 24 hours.  
We continue to monitor the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively monitoring river levels and the weather forecast and clearing debris from weed screens. 
Please stay aware in case further warnings are issued and avoid contact with flood water.

floodArea.riverOrSea: Sandyford Brook, Ridings Brook, Saredon Brook

items.message:
River levels have risen at the Stafford river gauge as a result of localised thunderstorms.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is possible overnight and into tomorrow, 13/06/23.  Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Sow between Great Bridgeford and Shugborough, the River Penk between Coven and Stafford, the Sandyford Brook, the Rising Brook, the Ridings Brook and the Saredon Brook.
There is uncertainty over the amount of rainfall expected and the exact location and timing of any further thunderstorms tonight.
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 12 hours.  We expect river levels to remain high until Tuesday morning, 13/06/23.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.
Please plan driving routes to avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses.
This message will be updated by 10:00 on 13/06/23, or as the situation changes.

This Flood Alert has been removed. River levels have now fallen below Flood Alert threshold. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this alert if necessary.   
Please avoid contact with flood water.

items.description: Honksford Brook at Mosley Common Road and Silk Mill Street

floodArea.riverOrSea: Ford Green Brook, Lyme Brook, River Trent

items.message:
River levels have risen at the Liverpool Road river gauge as a result of localised thunderstorms.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected this evening and overnight into Tuesday.  Flooding is affecting low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Trent between Norton Green and Darlaston including Stoke on Trent, Lyme Brook between Newcastle under Lyme and Hanford, Fowlea Brook at Stoke on Trent and Ford Green Brook.   
Further rainfall is forecast overnight.  We expect river levels to rise until later this overnight.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are clearing weed screens and actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and stay aware in case further warnings are issued.  
This message will be updated on 13/06/2023, or as the situation changes.

River levels have risen at the Packington river gauge as a result of localised thunderstorms.  Consequently, flooding of roads and farmland is expected this evening and overnight into Tuesday.  Flooding is affecting the Harlaston to Edingale Road and low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Mease and Gilwiskaw Brook between Ashby and Croxall.   
Further rainfall is forecast overnight.  We expect river levels to rise until later this overnight.
We are closely monitoring the situation.  Our incident response staff are clearing weed screens and actively checking river levels and the weather forecast.  
Please avoid using low lying footpaths and bridges near local watercourses and stay aware in case further warnings are issued.  
This message will be updated on 13/06/2023, or as the situation changes.
